title: This assignment tests you on how to use the collections API package in java

questionText.text:
Write a program, to implement ArrayList (Java API). Following are the operations:
addAll(int, E) : Inserts all of the elements in the specified collection into this list, starting at the specified position.
ensureCapacity(int) : Increases the capacity of this ArrayList instance, if necessary, to ensure that it can hold at least the number of elements specified by the minimum capacity argument.
get(int) : Returns the element at the specified position in this list.
median() : calculate the median of the elements in the arraylist.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you on how to use the collections API package in java

questionText.text:
Write a program, to implement Hashtable (Java API). Following are the operations:
put(K,V) : Maps the specified key to the specified value in this hashtable
get(K) : Returns the value to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key
equals(E) : Compares the specified Object with this Map for equality, as per the definition in the Map interface.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed

title: This assignment tests you on how to use the collections API package in java

questionText.text:
Write a program to create a dictionary of words for given text file.
Check your program against test cases below as a zip file. Submit your solution(zip file) when all test cases are passed
